intro: Chrysocoma pedunculata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
